universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Interface Refreshable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Scrollable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GridViewWidget, ListViewWidget, RecyclerViewWidget, WebViewWidget

    public interface Refreshable
extends Scrollable
    Interface for refreshable views. Specifies API for supporting the refresh feature for the views of which content can be refreshed by a user using the swipe to refresh pattern. Enabling the refresh feature for the Refreshable view can be done via setRefreshEnabled(boolean). To show or hide an indicator showing that the refresh is currently running can be done via setRefreshing(boolean) and passing boolean flag to indicate whether to pop or dismiss the indicator.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Refreshable.IndicatorTransition
      Defines an annotation for determining set of allowed transitions for refresh indicator of Refreshable widget.
      static interface  Refreshable.OnRefreshListener
      Listener which can receive callback about the initiated refresh.

      Transition type for the refresh indicator used for refreshing of a content that is above every other surface in z-space.

      Transition type for the refresh indicator used for refreshing of a content that is below another surface in z-space.
      static int TRANSITION_COPLANAR
      This transition type is not supported yet.
      static int TRANSITION_NONE
      Transition type for the refresh indicator indicating that no transition should be used when showing/hiding refresh indicator.

    • Field Detail

      • TRANSITION_NONE

        static final int TRANSITION_NONE
        Transition type for the refresh indicator indicating that no transition should be used when showing/hiding refresh indicator.

        This transition should not be used, it is here only for convenience and internal purpose.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSITION_BELOW

        static final int TRANSITION_BELOW
        Transition type for the refresh indicator used for refreshing of a content that is below another surface in z-space.

        This is basically any refreshable collection view (ListView, GridView, ...) that has above self an ActionBar or a Toolbar presented.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSITION_COPLANAR

        static final int TRANSITION_COPLANAR
        This transition type is not supported yet. Using this mode will resolve into same behaviour as described for TRANSITION_ABOVE transition.

        Transition type for the refresh indicator used for refreshing of a content that is coplanar with another surface.

        This is basically any refreshable collection view (ListView, GridView, ...) that is presented as coplanar with another surface presented above it.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSITION_ABOVE

        static final int TRANSITION_ABOVE
        Transition type for the refresh indicator used for refreshing of a content that is above every other surface in z-space.

        This is basically any refreshable collection view (ListView, GridView, ...) that is presented above a Toolbar and all surfaces in the current window's view hierarchy.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setRefreshEnabled

        void setRefreshEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the refresh feature is enabled for this view or not.

        Enabling this feature means, that a user can swipe down this view to refresh it if isRefreshGestureEnabled(), otherwise only refresh indicator can be shown/dismissed programmatically for this view via setRefreshing(boolean) method.

        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable refresh, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshEnabled, isRefreshEnabled(), setRefreshGestureEnabled(boolean)

      • isRefreshEnabled

        boolean isRefreshEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the refresh feature is enabled for this view or not.
        Returns:
        True if the refresh is enabled, so the refresh indicator can be shown for this view, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setRefreshEnabled(boolean), isRefreshGestureEnabled()

      • setRefreshGestureEnabled

        void setRefreshGestureEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Unlike setRefreshEnabled(boolean) this will enable/disable the refresh gesture so a user can/cannot swipe down this view to refresh it.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable refresh gesture, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshGestureEnabled, isRefreshGestureEnabled()

      • isRefreshGestureEnabled

        boolean isRefreshGestureEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the refresh gesture is enabled for this view or not.
        Returns:
        True if the refresh gesture is enabled, so a user can swipe down this view to refresh its content, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setRefreshGestureEnabled(boolean), setRefreshEnabled(boolean)

      • setRefreshing

        void setRefreshing(boolean refreshing)
        Sets a flag indicating whether this view is being refreshing or not. This flag determines whether to show the refresh indicator for this view or not.

        This should be called whenever the refresh for this view has been finished, so the indicator can be dismissed by setRefreshing(false), or whenever the refresh has been initiated by pressing a button, so the indicator should be popped by #setRefreshing(true).

        Note, that this does not need to be called from within OnRefreshListener.onRefresh(Refreshable) callback, as during this callback is the refresh indicator already showing.

        Parameters:
        refreshing - True if this view is being refreshing, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isRefreshing()

      • isRefreshing

        boolean isRefreshing()
        Returns a flag indicating whether this view is being refreshing or not.
        Returns:
        True if this view is being refreshing, so the refresh indicator is visible and spinning, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setRefreshing(boolean)

      • setRefreshIndicatorTransition

        void setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int transition)
        Sets the transition type for the refresh indicator. The transition determines the way how the refresh indicator should be transitioned while it is being pulled up/down by a user.

        Note, that for now TRANSITION_COPLANAR and TRANSITION_ABOVE behaves the same way. This is scheduled to be changed in the feature.

        Parameters:
        transition - The desired transition. One of TRANSITION_BELOW, TRANSITION_COPLANAR or TRANSITION_ABOVE.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshIndicatorTransition, getRefreshIndicatorTransition()

      • getRefreshIndicatorTransition

        int getRefreshIndicatorTransition()
        Returns the current transition type used for the refresh indicator hiding/showing.
        Returns:
        One of TRANSITION_BELOW, TRANSITION_COPLANAR or TRANSITION_ABOVE.
        See Also:
        setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int)

      • setDrawRefreshIndicator

        void setDrawRefreshIndicator(boolean draw)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether this refreshable view should draw its refresh indicator as part of its own drawing or not.

        This can be useful to draw refresh indicator outside of bounds of this view or at the different view hierarchy level if needed.

        Default value: true

        Parameters:
        draw - True to draw indicator as part of this view's graphics, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        drawsRefreshIndicator()

      • drawsRefreshIndicator

        boolean drawsRefreshIndicator()
        Returns boolean flag indicating whether this refreshable view draws its refresh indicator or not.
        Returns:
        True if refresh indicator is drawn by this view, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setDrawRefreshIndicator(boolean)

      • setOnRefreshListener

        void setOnRefreshListener(@Nullable
                          Refreshable.OnRefreshListener listener)
        Registers a callback to be invoked whenever a user releases the refresh indicator at or after the refresh position.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener callback. May be null to clear the current one.
